oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bright Hill Missionary Baptist Church: plaque 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 4650 Ballard Slough Rd, Tipton Co., TN

Color photograph of painted silver plaque against yellow brick; reads "Bright-Hill-M-B-Church; Re-Erected = 1952; IS Burton = Officers; PW-Burton; C-Smith; C-E-Green; Clara-Green=CK; N-C-Stewart; Sherrill; ED-Draine=M; E-M Anderson"; words partially obscurred by bushes
Bright Hill Missionary Baptist Church is an important mid-20th century property associated with one of the oldest African American communities along the Mississippi River in Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
Churches
